item.title: Odin Project Javascript
item.description: Factory Functions One of the main problems with object constructors is that they look like regular JS functions, however operate very differently These functions are very similar to object constructors work, but instead of using the “new” keyword to create an object, they set up and return the object within the function They do not use the prototype, so they aren’t as efficient const User = function (name) { this.name = name; this.
